episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and intriguing facts, including the unusual death of a children's author, a city in Japan dedicated to haiku, historical debates about cinema lighting, and a humorously named diving club in Ireland.

facts.fact: Children's author, Margaret Wise Brown, died from doing an over-enthusiastic can-can kick.
The city of Matsuyama has over 90 post boxes specifically for mailing haiku.
In the early 1900s there was a debate over whether cinemas should be dark or fully lit.
One of the oldest diving clubs in Ireland is the Muff Diving Club.
